types.block:
/** raw binary formatted id */
unsigned char id[GIT_OID_RAWSZ];

GIT_OBJ_ANY = -2,		/**< Object can be any of the following */
GIT_OBJ_BAD = -1,       /**< Object is invalid. */
GIT_OBJ__EXT1 = 0,      /**< Reserved for future use. */
GIT_OBJ_COMMIT = 1,     /**< A commit object. */
GIT_OBJ_TREE = 2,       /**< A tree (directory listing) object. */
GIT_OBJ_BLOB = 3,       /**< A file revision object. */
GIT_OBJ_TAG = 4,        /**< An annotated tag object. */
GIT_OBJ__EXT2 = 5,      /**< Reserved for future use. */
GIT_OBJ_OFS_DELTA = 6,  /**< A delta, base is given by an offset. */
GIT_OBJ_REF_DELTA = 7,  /**< A delta, base is given by object id. */

void *data;          /**< Raw, decompressed object data. */
size_t len;          /**< Total number of bytes in data. */
git_otype type;      /**< Type of this object. */

GIT_REF_INVALID = 0, /** Invalid reference */
GIT_REF_OID = 1, /** A reference which points at an object id */
GIT_REF_SYMBOLIC = 2, /** A reference which points at another reference */
GIT_REF_PACKED = 4,
GIT_REF_HAS_PEEL = 8,

char *name; /** full name of the author */
char *email; /** email of the author */
git_time when; /** time when the action happened */

time_t time; /** time in seconds from epoch */
int offset; /** timezone offset, in minutes */

meta.brief: Git blob load and write routines
meta.defgroup: git_blob Git blob load and write routines
git_commit Git commit parsing, formatting routines

meta.brief: Git error handling routines and variables
Git index parsing and manipulation routines
meta.defgroup: git_index Git index parsing and manipulation routines
git_object Git revision object management routines
git_tree Git tree parsing, loading routines

git_tag_set_target.description: Set the target of a tag (i.e. the object that the tag points to)

git_tree_remove_entry_byname.description: Remove an entry by its filename.

args.comment: Tree where to remove the entry
args.name: tree

return.comment: 0 on successful removal; GIT_ENOTFOUND if the entry wasn't found

git_tree_remove_entry_byname.comments:
This will mark the tree as modified; the modified entry will
 be written back to disk on the next git_object_write()

git_tree_entry_attributes.description: Get the UNIX file attributes of a tree entry

args.comment: The repository where the object will reside
args.name: repo

git_tree_new.comments:
The tree object must be manually filled using
 setter methods before it can be written to its
 repository.

git_commit_parentcount.description: Get the number of parents of this commit

git_oid_mkstr.description: Parse a hex formatted object id into a git_oid.

args.comment: oid structure the result is written into.
args.name: out

args.comment: input hex string; must be pointing at the start of         the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes         needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).
args.name: str

return.comment: GIT_SUCCESS if valid; GIT_ENOTOID on failure.

git_reference_create_oid.description: Create a new object id reference.

args.comment: Pointer to the newly created reference
args.name: ref_out

args.comment: Repository where that reference will live
args.name: repo

args.comment: The object id pointed to by the reference.
args.name: id

git_reference_create_oid.argline: git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const git_oid *id
git_reference_create_oid.comments:
The reference will be created in the repository and written
 to the disk.

 This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
 be free'd by the user.

git_tree_lookup.description: Lookup a tree object from the repository. The generated tree object is owned by the revision repo and shall not be freed by the user.

args.comment: pointer to the looked up tree
args.name: tree

args.comment: the repo to use when locating the tree.
args.name: repo

args.comment: identity of the tree to locate.
args.name: id

git_tag_set_message.description: Set the message of a tag

args.comment: the new tagger for the tag
args.name: message

git_tag_set_tagger.description: Set the tagger of a tag

git_odb_open.rawComments:
Create a new object database and automatically add
 the two default backends:

	- git_odb_backend_loose: read and write loose object files
		from disk, assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder

	- git_odb_backend_pack: read objects from packfiles,
		assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder which
		contains a 'pack/' folder with the corresponding data

 @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
            Set to NULL if the open failed.
 @param objects_dir path of the backends' "objects" directory.
 @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database opened; otherwise an error
         code describing why the open was not possible.
git_odb_open.description: Create a new object database and automatically add the two default backends:

args.comment: location to store the database pointer, if opened.             Set to NULL if the open failed.
args.name: out

return.comment: GIT_SUCCESS if the database opened; otherwise an error          code describing why the open was not possible.

git_odb_open.comments:
- git_odb_backend_loose: read and write loose object files
		from disk, assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder

	- git_odb_backend_pack: read objects from packfiles,
		assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder which
		contains a 'pack/' folder with the corresponding data

git_reference_set_target.description: Set the symbolic target of a reference.

args.comment: The new target for the reference
args.name: target

git_reference_set_target.comments:
The reference must be a symbolic reference, otherwise
 this method will fail.

 The reference will be automatically updated in
 memory and on disk.

git_commit_message.description: Get the full message of a commit.

git_tree_entry_set_attributes.description: Change the attributes of a tree entry.

args.comment: Entry object which will be modified
args.name: entry

git_rawobj_hash.description: Determine the object-ID (sha1 hash) of the given git_rawobj.

args.comment: the object whose hash is to be determined.
args.name: obj

git_rawobj_hash.comments:
The input obj must be a valid loose object type and the data
 pointer must not be NULL, unless the len field is also zero.

 @return
 - GIT_SUCCESS if the object-ID was correctly determined.
 - GIT_ERROR if the given object is malformed.

GIT_EXTERN.rawComments: An instance for a custom backend
GIT_EXTERN.description: An instance for a custom backend

git_commit_time_offset.description: Get the commit timezone offset (i.e. committer's preferred timezone) of a commit.

return.comment: positive or negative timezone offset, in minutes from UTC

git_revwalk_free.rawComments:
Free a revwalk previously allocated.
 @param walk traversal handle to close.  If NULL nothing occurs.

args.comment: traversal handle to close.  If NULL nothing occurs.
args.name: walk

git_commit_set_tree.description: Set the tree which is pointed to by a commit

git_revwalk_new.description: Allocate a new revision walker to iterate through a repo.

args.comment: pointer to the new revision walker
args.name: walker

git_signature_new.description: Create a new action signature. The signature must be freed manually or using git_signature_free

return.comment: the new sig, NULl on out of memory

git_signature_new.argline: const char *name, const char *email, time_t time, int offset

git_signature_dup.description: Create a copy of an existing signature.

return.comment: a copy of sig, NULL on out of memory

git_signature_dup.comments:
All internal strings are also duplicated.
 @sig signature to duplicated

git_repository_index.description: Get the Index file of a Git repository

args.comment: Pointer where to store the index
args.name: index

return.comment: 0 on success; error code if the index could not be opened

git_repository_index.comments:
This is a cheap operation; the index is only opened on the first call,
 and subsequent calls only retrieve the previous pointer.

git_tag_name.description: Get the name of a tag @param tag a previously loaded tag.

git_blob_rawcontent.description: Get a read-only buffer with the raw content of a blob.

return.comment: the pointer; NULL if the blob has no contents

git_blob_rawcontent.comments:
A pointer to the raw content of a blob is returned;
 this pointer is owned internally by the object and shall
 not be free'd. The pointer may be invalidated at a later
 time (e.g. when changing the contents of the blob).

git_tree_add_entry.description: Add a new entry to a tree and return the new entry.

args.comment: Pointer to the entry that just got  created. May be NULL if you are not interested on  getting the new entry
args.name: entry_out

args.comment: Tree object to store the entry
args.name: tree

args.comment: UNIX file attributes for the entry
args.name: attributes

git_tree_add_entry.argline: git_tree_entry **entry_out, git_tree *tree, const git_oid *id, const char *filename, int attributes

git_object_typeisloose.description: Determine if the given git_otype is a valid loose object type.

return.comment: true if the type represents a valid loose object type,  false otherwise.

git_revwalk_repository.description: Return the repository on which this walker is operating.

git_tree_clear_entries.rawComments:
Clear all the entries in a tree.

 This will mark the tree as modified; the modified entry will
 be written back to disk on the next git_object_write().

 @param tree Tree object whose entries are to be sorted
git_tree_clear_entries.description: Clear all the entries in a tree.

args.comment: Tree object whose entries are to be sorted
args.name: tree

git_tree_clear_entries.comments:
This will mark the tree as modified; the modified entry will
 be written back to disk on the next git_object_write().

git_reference_type.description: Get the type of a reference

git_odb_add_alternate.description: Add a custom backend to an existing Object DB; this backend will work as an alternate.

args.comment: database to add the backend to
args.name: odb

git_odb_add_alternate.comments:
Alternate backends are always checked for objects *after*
 all the main backends have been exhausted.

 Writing is disabled on alternate backends.

 Read <odb_backends.h> for more information.

 @paramm backend pointer to a git_odb_backend instance

git_revwalk_hide.description: Mark a commit (and its ancestors) uninteresting for the output. @param walker the walker being used for the traversal.

args.comment: the commit that will be ignored during the traversal
args.name: commit

args.comment: Pointer to the newly created reference
args.name: ref_out

args.comment: Repository where that reference will live
args.name: repo

git_reference_create_symbolic.argline: git_reference **ref_out, git_repository *repo, const char *name, const char *target
git_reference_create_symbolic.comments:
The reference will be created in the repository and written
 to the disk.

 This reference is owned by the repository and shall not
 be free'd by the user.

git_object_id.description: Get the id (SHA1) of a repository object
git_object_id.comments:
In-memory objects created by git_object_new() do not
 have a SHA1 ID until they are written on a repository.

git_object_lookup.description: Lookup a reference to one of the objects in a repostory.

args.comment: the repository to look up the object
args.name: repo

args.comment: the unique identifier for the object
args.name: id

git_object_lookup.argline: git_object **object, git_repository *repo, const git_oid *id, git_otype type
git_object_lookup.comments:
The generated reference is owned by the repository and
 should not be freed by the user.

 The 'type' parameter must match the type of the object
 in the odb; the method will fail otherwise.
 The special value 'GIT_OBJ_ANY' may be passed to let
 the method guess the object's type.

git_reference_oid.description: Get the OID pointed to by a reference.

return.comment: a pointer to the oid if available, NULL otherwise

git_reference_oid.comments: Only available if the reference is direct (i.e. not symbolic)

git_commit_set_committer.description: Set the committer of a commit @param author_sig signature of the committer

__attribute__.description: Declare a public TLS symbol exported for application use.

args.comment: the new commit which will be a parent
args.name: new_parent

return.comment: a pointer to the object db

Close an open object database.

Read <odb_backends.h> for more information.

git_index_insert.description: Insert an entry into the index. A full copy (including the 'path' string) of the given 'source_entry' will be inserted on the index; if the index already contains an entry for the same path, the entry will be updated.

return.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

args.comment: The repository where the object will reside
args.name: repo

git_blob_new.comments:
The blob object must be manually filled using
 the 'set_rawcontent' methods before it can
 be written back to disk.

git_object_type.description: Get the object type of an object

git_rawobj_close.rawComments:
Release all memory used by the obj structure.

 As a result of this call, obj->data will be set to NULL.

 If obj->data is already NULL, nothing happens.

 @param obj object descriptor to free.
git_rawobj_close.description: Release all memory used by the obj structure.
git_rawobj_close.comments:
As a result of this call, obj->data will be set to NULL.

 If obj->data is already NULL, nothing happens.

args.comment: name of the file to read
args.name: filename

git_index_add.description: Add or update an index entry from a file in disk.

return.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

deflateBound.description: deflateBound returns an upper bound on the compressed size.

args.comment: total length of the source data (in bytes).
args.name: s

return.comment: maximum length of the compressed data.

deflateBound.comments:
This is a stub function used when zlib does not supply the
 deflateBound() implementation itself.

git_index_get.description: Get a pointer to one of the entries in the index

return.comment: a pointer to the entry; NULL if out of bounds

git_index_get.comments:
This entry can be modified, and the changes will be written
 back to disk on the next write() call.

git_repository_free.rawComments:
Free a previously allocated repository
 @param repo repository handle to close. If NULL nothing occurs.

args.comment: repository handle to close. If NULL nothing occurs.
args.name: repo

args.comment: The repository where the object will reside
args.name: repo

git_tag_new.comments:
The tag object must be manually filled using
 setter methods before it can be written to its
 repository.

git_oid_cpy.description: Copy an oid from one structure to another.

args.comment: oid structure the result is written into.
args.name: out

git_object_write.rawComments:
Write back an object to disk.

 The object will be written to its corresponding
 repository.

 If the object has no changes since it was first
 read from the repository, no actions will take place.

 If the object has been modified since it was read from
 the repository, or it has been created from scratch
 in memory, it will be written to the repository and
 its SHA1 ID will be updated accordingly.

 @param object Git object to write back
 @return 0 on success; otherwise an error code
git_object_write.description: Write back an object to disk.

return.comment: 0 on success; otherwise an error code

git_object_write.comments:
The object will be written to its corresponding
 repository.

 If the object has no changes since it was first
 read from the repository, no actions will take place.

 If the object has been modified since it was read from
 the repository, or it has been created from scratch
 in memory, it will be written to the repository and
 its SHA1 ID will be updated accordingly.

git_index_open_inrepo.description: Open the Index inside the git repository pointed by 'repo'.

args.comment: the git repo which owns the index
args.name: repo

git_index_open_inrepo.comments: @param index_path the path to the index file in disk

git_revwalk_next.description: Get the next commit from the revision traversal.

args.comment: Pointer where to store the next commit
args.name: commit

args.comment: the walker to pop the commit from.
args.name: walk

return.comment: GIT_SUCCESS if the next commit was found;  GIT_EREVWALKOVER if there are no commits left to iterate

git_repository_init.description: Creates a new Git repository in the given folder.

args.comment: pointer to the repo which will be created or reinitialized
args.name: repo_out

args.comment: if true, a Git repository without a working directory is created   at the pointed path. If false, provided path will be considered as the working   directory into which the .git directory will be created.
args.name: is_bare

git_repository_init.comments:
TODO:
	- Reinit the repository
	- Create config files

git_index_clear.rawComments:
Clear the contents (all the entries) of an index object.
 This clears the index object in memory; changes must be manually
 written to disk for them to take effect.

 @param index an existing index object
git_index_clear.description: Clear the contents (all the entries) of an index object. This clears the index object in memory; changes must be manually written to disk for them to take effect.

git_tree_entrycount.description: Get the number of entries listed in a tree

return.comment: the number of entries in the tree

git_commit_time.description: Get the commit time (i.e. committer time) of a commit.

Free an existing index object.

 @param index an existing index object

return.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

git_tag_target.description: Get the tagged object of a tag @param tag a previously loaded tag.

git_revwalk_push.description: Mark a commit to start traversal from. The commit object must belong to the repo which is being walked through.
git_revwalk_push.comments: @param walker the walker being used for the traversal.

args.name: repo

args.comment: identity of the blob to locate.

args.name: oid

git_tree_entry_set_id.comments:
This will mark the tree that contains the entry as modified;
 the modified entry will be written back to disk on the next git_object_write()

git_odb_new.rawComments:
Create a new object database with no backends.

 Before the ODB can be used for read/writing, a custom database
 backend must be manually added using `git_odb_add_backend()`

 @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
            Set to NULL if the open failed.
 @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database was created; otherwise an error
         code describing why the open was not possible.
git_odb_new.description: Create a new object database with no backends.

args.comment: location to store the database pointer, if opened.             Set to NULL if the open failed.
args.name: out

return.comment: GIT_SUCCESS if the database was created; otherwise an error          code describing why the open was not possible.

git_odb_new.comments:
Before the ODB can be used for read/writing, a custom database
 backend must be manually added using `git_odb_add_backend()`

git_commit_tree.description: Get the tree pointed to by a commit.

git_oid_allocfmt.description: Format a gid_oid into a newly allocated c-string.

return.comment: the c-string; NULL if memory is exhausted.  Caller must          deallocate the string with free().

git_tag_tagger.description: Get the tagger (author) of a tag @param tag a previously loaded tag.

git_tree_remove_entry_byindex.description: Remove an entry by its index.

args.comment: Tree where to remove the entry
args.name: tree

return.comment: 0 on successful removal; GIT_ENOTFOUND if the entry wasn't found

git_tree_remove_entry_byindex.comments:
Index must be >= 0 and < than git_tree_entrycount().

 This will mark the tree as modified; the modified entry will
 be written back to disk on the next git_object_write()

git_reference_lookup.description: Lookup a reference by its name in a repository.

args.comment: the repository to look up the reference
args.name: repo

args.comment: the long name for the reference (e.g. HEAD, ref/heads/master, refs/tags/v0.1.0, ...)
args.name: name

git_reference_lookup.comments:
The generated reference is owned by the repository and
 should not be freed by the user.

git_commit_committer.description: Get the committer of a commit.

git_reference_resolve.comments:
Thie method iteratively peels a symbolic reference
 until it resolves to a direct reference to an OID.

 If a direct reference is passed as an argument,
 that reference is returned immediately

git_tag_set_name.description: Set the name of a tag

args.comment: the new name for the tag
args.name: name

git_reference_name.description: Get the full name of a reference

return.comment: the full name for the ref

git_odb_exists.description: Determine if the given object can be found in the object database.

args.comment: database to be searched for the given object.
args.name: db

git_tag_message.description: Get the message of a tag @param tag a previously loaded tag.

git_reference_owner.description: Get the repository where a reference resides

git_reference_packall.rawComments:
Pack all the loose references in the repository

 This method will load into the cache all the loose
 references on the repository and update the
 `packed-refs` file with them.

 Once the `packed-refs` file has been written properly,
 the loose references will be removed from disk.

 WARNING: calling this method may invalidate any existing
 references previously loaded on the cache.

 @param repo Repository where the loose refs will be packed
 @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
git_reference_packall.description: Pack all the loose references in the repository

args.comment: Repository where the loose refs will be packed
args.name: repo

git_reference_packall.comments:
This method will load into the cache all the loose
 references on the repository and update the
 `packed-refs` file with them.

 Once the `packed-refs` file has been written properly,
 the loose references will be removed from disk.

 WARNING: calling this method may invalidate any existing
 references previously loaded on the cache.

return.comment: a string explaining the error code

git_blob_writefile.description: Read a file from the working folder of a repository and write it to the Object Database as a loose blob, if such doesn't exist yet.

args.comment: return the id of the written blob
args.name: written_id

args.comment: repository where the blob will be written
args.name: repo

args.comment: file from which the blob will be created
args.name: path

git_oid_pathfmt.rawComments:
Format a git_oid into a loose-object path string.

The resulting string is "aa/...", where "aa" is the first two hex digitis of the oid and "..." is the remaining 38 digits. @param str output hex string; must be pointing at the start of the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes needed for an oid encoded in hex (41 bytes). Only the oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added by the caller if it is required. @param oid oid structure to format.
git_oid_pathfmt.description:
Format a git_oid into a loose-object path string.

The resulting string is "aa/...", where "aa" is the first two hex digitis of the oid and "..." is the remaining 38 digits.

args.comment: output hex string; must be pointing at the start of         the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes         needed for an oid encoded in hex (41 bytes).  Only the         oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added         by the caller if it is required.
args.name: str

git_commit_id.description: Get the id of a commit.

git_commit_set_author.description: Set the author of a commit

git_tree_id.description: Get the id of a tree.

git_index_find.description: Find the first index of any entires which point to given path in the Git index.

git_odb_read_header.description: Read the header of an object from the database, without reading its full contents.

args.comment: object descriptor to populate upon reading.
args.name: out

args.comment: database to search for the object in.
args.name: db

args.comment: identity of the object to read.
args.name: id

git_odb_read_header.comments:
Only the 'type' and 'len' fields of the git_rawobj structure
 are filled. The 'data' pointer will always be NULL.

 The raw object pointed by 'out' doesn't need to be manually
 closed with git_rawobj_close().

 @return
 - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
 - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.

git_repository_open.rawComments:
Open a git repository.

 The 'path' argument must point to an existing git repository
 folder, e.g.

		/path/to/my_repo/.git/	(normal repository)
							objects/
							index
							HEAD

		/path/to/bare_repo/		(bare repository)
						objects/
						index
						HEAD

	The method will automatically detect if 'path' is a normal
	or bare repository or fail is 'path' is neither.

 @param repository pointer to the repo which will be opened
 @param path the path to the repository
 @return 0 on success; error code otherwise

args.comment: pointer to the repo which will be opened
args.name: repository

git_repository_open.comments:
The 'path' argument must point to an existing git repository
 folder, e.g.

		/path/to/my_repo/.git/	(normal repository)
							objects/
							index
							HEAD

		/path/to/bare_repo/		(bare repository)
						objects/
						index
						HEAD

	The method will automatically detect if 'path' is a normal
	or bare repository or fail is 'path' is neither.

git_index_read.description: Update the contents of an existing index object in memory by reading from the hard disk.

return.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

git_signature_free.rawComments:
Free an existing signature

 @sig signature to free

git_commit_author.description: Get the author of a commit.

git_odb_write.description: Write an object to the database.

args.comment: database to which the object should be written.
args.name: db

args.comment: object descriptor for the object to write.
args.name: obj

git_commit_set_message.description: Set the message of a commit

args.comment: The repository where the object will reside
args.name: repo

git_commit_new.comments:
The commit object must be manually filled using
 setter methods before it can be written to its
 repository.

git_odb_read.description: Read an object from the database.

args.comment: object descriptor to populate upon reading.
args.name: out

args.comment: database to search for the object in.
args.name: db

args.comment: identity of the object to read.
args.name: id

git_tag_type.description: Get the type of a tag's tagged object @param tag a previously loaded tag.

git_blob_set_rawcontent.description: Fill a blob with the contents inside the pointed buffer

args.comment: buffer with the contents for the blob
args.name: buffer

git_reference_set_oid.description: Set the OID target of a reference.
git_reference_set_oid.comments:
The reference must be a direct reference, otherwise
 this method will fail.

 The reference will be automatically updated in
 memory and on disk.

 @param target The new target OID for the reference

git_index_open_bare.description: Create a new Git index object as a memory representation of the Git index file in 'index_path', without a repository to back it.

args.comment: the pointer for the new index
args.name: index

args.comment: the path to the index file in disk
args.name: index_path

git_index_open_bare.comments:
Since there is no ODB behind this index, any Index methods
 which rely on the ODB (e.g. index_add) will fail with the
 GIT_EBAREINDEX error code.

git_object_new.rawComments:
Create a new in-memory repository object with
 the given type.

 The object's attributes can be filled in using the
 corresponding setter methods.

 The object will be written back to given git_repository
 when the git_object_write() function is called; objects
 cannot be written to disk until all their main
 attributes have been properly filled.

 Objects are instantiated with no SHA1 id; their id
 will be automatically generated when writing to the
 repository.

 @param object pointer to the new object
 @parem repo Repository where the object belongs
 @param type Type of the object to be created
 @return the new object
git_object_new.description: Create a new in-memory repository object with the given type.

args.comment: Type of the object to be created
args.name: type

git_object_new.comments:
The object's attributes can be filled in using the
 corresponding setter methods.

 The object will be written back to given git_repository
 when the git_object_write() function is called; objects
 cannot be written to disk until all their main
 attributes have been properly filled.

 Objects are instantiated with no SHA1 id; their id
 will be automatically generated when writing to the
 repository.

 @parem repo Repository where the object belongs

git_tree_entry_name.description: Get the filename of a tree entry

git_object__size.rawComments:
Get the size in bytes for the structure which
 acts as an in-memory representation of any given
 object type.

 For all the core types, this would the equivalent
 of calling `sizeof(git_commit)` if the core types
 were not opaque on the external API.

 @param type object type to get its size
 @return size in bytes of the object
git_object__size.description: Get the size in bytes for the structure which acts as an in-memory representation of any given object type.

args.comment: object type to get its size
args.name: type

return.comment: size in bytes of the object

git_object__size.comments:
For all the core types, this would the equivalent
 of calling `sizeof(git_commit)` if the core types
 were not opaque on the external API.

git_commit_lookup.description: Lookup a commit object from a repository. The generated commit object is owned by the revision repo and shall not be freed by the user.

args.comment: pointer to the looked up commit
args.name: commit

args.comment: the repo to use when locating the commit.
args.name: repo

args.comment: identity of the commit to locate.  If the object is         an annotated tag it will be peeled back to the commit.
args.name: id

git_object_owner.description: Get the repository that owns this object

return.comment: the repository who owns this object

git_oid_fmt.rawComments:
Format a git_oid into a hex string.
 @param str output hex string; must be pointing at the start of
        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
        needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).  Only the
        oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added
        by the caller if it is required.
 @param oid oid structure to format.
git_oid_fmt.description: Format a git_oid into a hex string.

args.comment: output hex string; must be pointing at the start of         the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes         needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).  Only the         oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added         by the caller if it is required.
args.name: str

git_commit_message_short.description: Get the short (one line) message of a commit.

return.comment: the short message of a commit

git_reference_delete.rawComments:
Delete an existing reference

 This method works for both direct and symbolic references.

 The reference will be immediately removed on disk and from
 memory. The given reference pointer will no longer be valid.
git_reference_delete.comments:
This method works for both direct and symbolic references.

 The reference will be immediately removed on disk and from
 memory. The given reference pointer will no longer be valid.

git_oid_to_string.description:
Format a git_oid into a buffer as a hex format c-string.

If the buffer is smaller than GIT_OID_HEXSZ+1, then the resulting oid c-string will be truncated to n-1 characters. If there are any input parameter errors (out == NULL, n == 0, oid == NULL), then a pointer to an empty string is returned, so that the return value can always be printed.

args.comment: the buffer into which the oid string is output.
args.name: out

args.comment: the size of the out buffer.
args.name: n

return.comment: the out buffer pointer, assuming no input parameter          errors, otherwise a pointer to an empty string.

git_index_entrycount.description: Get the count of entries currently in the index

return.comment: integer of count of current entries

git_oid_mkraw.description: Copy an already raw oid into a git_oid structure.

args.comment: oid structure the result is written into.
args.name: out

args.comment: the raw input bytes to be copied.
args.name: raw

git_reference_rename.rawComments:
Rename an existing reference

 This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
 The new name will be checked for validity and may be
 modified into a normalized form.

 The refernece will be immediately renamed in-memory
 and on disk.
git_reference_rename.comments:
This method works for both direct and symbolic references.
 The new name will be checked for validity and may be
 modified into a normalized form.

 The refernece will be immediately renamed in-memory
 and on disk.

git_revwalk_reset.rawComments:
Reset the walking machinery for reuse.
 @param walker handle to reset.
git_revwalk_reset.description: Reset the walking machinery for reuse.

git_object_close.rawComments:
Close an open object

 This method instructs the library to close an existing
 object; note that git_objects are owned by the repository
 and are reference counted, so the object may or may not be
 freed after this library call, depending on whether any other
 objects still depend on it.

 IMPORTANT:
 It is *not* necessary to call this method when you stop using
 an object, since all object memory is automatically reclaimed
 by the repository when it is freed.

 Forgetting to call `git_object_close` does not cause memory
 leaks, but it's is recommended to close as soon as possible
 the biggest objects (e.g. blobs) to prevent wasting memory
 space.

 @param object the object to close
git_object_close.comments:
This method instructs the library to close an existing
 object; note that git_objects are owned by the repository
 and are reference counted, so the object may or may not be
 freed after this library call, depending on whether any other
 objects still depend on it.

 IMPORTANT:
 It is *not* necessary to call this method when you stop using
 an object, since all object memory is automatically reclaimed
 by the repository when it is freed.

 Forgetting to call `git_object_close` does not cause memory
 leaks, but it's is recommended to close as soon as possible
 the biggest objects (e.g. blobs) to prevent wasting memory
 space.
